Enumeration Type Documentation

enum port_map_if_type

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

These are the interface types needed to convert interface numbers to ipd ports.

Parameters:
GMII This type is used for sgmii, rgmii, xaui and rxaui interfaces.
ILK This type is used for ilk interfaces.
SRIO This type is used for serial-RapidIo interfaces.
NPI This type is used for npi interfaces.
LB This type is used for loopback interfaces.
INVALID_IF_TYPE This type indicates the interface hasn't been configured.
Enumerator:
INVALID_IF_TYPE 
GMII 
ILK 
SRIO 
NPI 
LB 

Function Documentation

int __cvmx_helper_setup_gmx ( int  xiface,
int  num_ports 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Setup the common GMX settings that determine the number of ports. These setting apply to almost all configurations of all chips.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to configure
num_ports Number of ports on the interface
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure

void cvmx_helper_free_packet_data ( cvmx_wqe_t *  work  ) 

Free the packet buffers contained in a work queue entry.

The work queue entry is also freed if it contains packet data. If however the packet starts outside the WQE, the WQE will not be freed. The application should call cvmx_wqe_free() to free the WQE buffer that contains no packet data.

Parameters:
work Work queue entry with packet to free

void cvmx_helper_setup_legacy_red ( int  pass_thresh,
int  drop_thresh 
)
int cvmx_helper_setup_red ( int  pass_thresh,
int  drop_thresh 
)

Setup Random Early Drop to automatically begin dropping packets.

Parameters:
pass_thresh Packets will begin slowly dropping when there are less than this many packet buffers free in FPA 0.
drop_thresh All incomming packets will be dropped when there are less than this many free packet buffers in FPA 0.
Returns:
Zero on success. Negative on failure

size_t  count

Parameters:
addr Start address to print on the left
[in] buffer array of bytes to print

void cvmx_wqe_free ( cvmx_wqe_t *  work  ) 

Free Work Queue Entry memory.

Will return the WQE buffer to its pool, unless the WQE contains non-redundant packet data. This function is intended to be called AFTER the packet data has been passed along to PKO for transmission and release. It can also follow a call to cvmx_helper_free_packet_data() to release the WQE after associated data was released.

cvmx_buf_ptr_t cvmx_wqe_get_packet_ptr ( cvmx_wqe_t *  work  ) 

Extract packet data buffer pointer from work queue entry.

Returns the legacy (Octeon1/Octeon2) buffer pointer structure for the linked buffer list. On CN78XX, the native buffer pointer structure is converted into the legacy format. The legacy buf_ptr is then stored in the WQE, and word0 reserved field is set to indicate that the buffer pointers were translated. If the packet data is only found inside the work queue entry, a standard buffer pointer structure is created for it.

struct ipd_port_map ipd_port_map_68xx[CVMX_HELPER_MAX_IFACE] [static]
Initial value:
 {
    {GMII,  0x800,  0x8ff,  0x40},      
    {GMII,  0x900,  0x9ff,  0x40},      
    {GMII,  0xa00,  0xaff,  0x40},      
    {GMII,  0xb00,  0xbff,  0x40},      
    {GMII,  0xc00,  0xcff,  0x40},      
    {ILK,   0x400,  0x4ff,  0x00},      
    {ILK,   0x500,  0x5ff,  0x00},      
    {NPI,   0x100,  0x120,  0x00},      
    {LB,    0x000,  0x008,  0x00},      
}

    {GMII,  0xb00,  0xb3f,  0x00},      
    {GMII,  0xc00,  0xc3f,  0x00},

    {NPI,   0x100,  0x13f,  0x00},      
    {LB,    0x000,  0x03f,  0x00},      
}

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Interface number to ipd port map for the octeon 78xx.

This mapping corresponds to WQE(CHAN) enumeration in HRM Sections 11.15, PKI_CHAN_E, Section 11.6
